item.title: Gemini 3 Pro Is Now Available in JetBrains IDEs
item.description: The latest AI model from Google, Gemini 3 Pro, is now live in JetBrains IDEs. From day one, it powers AI Chat and soon will be available in Junie, our coding agent, giving you smarter reasoning, stronger instruction following, and seamless integration into your workflow. What‚Äôs new Gemini 3 Pro shows clear improvements that matter [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/gemini-3-pro-is-now-available-in-jetbrains-ides/

item.title: The Second Release of MPS 2025.3 Early Access Program
item.description: Starting today, you can download the second EAP release for MPS 2025.3 and try all the latest updates. DOWNLOAD MPS 2025.3 EAP 2 This release includes several noteworthy improvements: JavaDoc language overhaul The JavaDoc language has been completely migrated to use the jetbrains.mps.lang.text language for text representation and editing. This change should have minimal impact [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/mps/2025/11/the-mps-2025-3-eap2/

item.title: Database Features in Rider
item.description: Rider provides robust support for working with databases directly within the IDE ‚Äì powered by DataGrip! item.title: Mark Your Calendars! Qodana Events in November
item.description: As 2025 starts racing to a close, the JetBrains Qodana team is ending the year with a series of events dedicated to what matters most in modern software development: secure workflows, high-quality code, and practical tooling that empowers developers to ship with confidence. Whether you‚Äôre working in security engineering, backend development, DevOps, or AI-powered applications, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/qodana/2025/11/mark-your-calendars-qodana-events-in-november/

item.title: Why Diffusion Models Could Change Developer Workflows in 2026
item.description: Developers spend much of their time editing, refactoring, and debugging rather than producing entirely new code. Code creation tends to involve non-sequential back-and-forth refinement rather than typing out a complete function in one uninterrupted sequence. You might sketch a part, adjust parameters, skip ahead, then revisit earlier sections to refine them.¬†Diffusion models, and in [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/11/why-diffusion-models-could-change-developer-workflows-in-2026/

item.title: JetBrains Is Heading to VSLive! Orlando
